tit.e: Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase (Imperial Palace Poetry Contest in the Tentoku era)
Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase (Imperial Palace Poetry Contest in the Tentoku era)
tit.cmt: タイトルですので、補足は削除しました。

sen.j: 天徳内裏歌合（てんとくだいりうたあわせ）は、天徳 (日本)4年3月30日 (旧暦)（960年4月28日）、村上天皇によって行われた歌合。
sen.e: Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase is a poetry contest hosted by Emperor Murakami on April 28, 960.
Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase was a poetry contest hosted by Emperor Murakami on April 28, 960.
Tentoku Dairi Uta-awase (Imperial Palace Poetry Contest in the Tentoku era) was a poetry contest hosted by Emperor Murakami on May 3, 960.
sen.cmt: 天徳内裏歌合 の補足を追加しました。グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 概要
歌題の提示から当日まで1ヶ月の期間をおいた。
sen.e: There was a period of one month from the announcement of the poetic themes to the contest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was a period of one month from the announcement of the poetic themes to the contest.
There was a period of one month between the announcement of the poetic themes to the date of the contest.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: 進め方や左右双方の衣裳、歌を書いた和紙色紙を置く州浜（入り江などをかたどった飾り台）にいたるまで周到に準備されたものだった。
sen.e: Meticulous preparations were made from the procedure and the costumes for both the right and the left side to a suhama stand (decorative cove-shaped stand) on which poetry cards made of Japanese paper were placed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Meticulous preparations were made from the procedure and the costumes for both the right and the left side to a suhama stand (decorative cove-shaped stand) on which poetry cards made of Japanese paper were placed.

Meticulous preparations were made, from the procedures and costumes for both the right and the left side, to a suhama stand (decorative cove-shaped stand) on which were placed poetry cards made of Japanese paper.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: その典雅さなどで後世の歌合の手本となった。
sen.e: Such a graceful elegance of the Tentoku imperial poetry contest became a model for the subsequent poetic contests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Such a graceful elegance of the Tentoku imperial poetry contest became a model for the subsequent poetic contests.
Such a graceful elegance of the Tentoku imperial poetry contest became a model for subsequent poetic contests.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: 3月初めに示された題は霞、鶯、柳、桜、款冬（山吹）、藤、暮春、首夏、郭公（ほととぎす）、卯花、夏草、恋の12。
sen.e: Twelve themes were announced in late March: haze, bush warbler, willow, cherry blossom, kerria, wisteria, late spring, early summer, cuckoo (hototogisu), deutzia, summer grass, and love.
sen.cmt: 「3月初めに」は新暦に変更したのにともない、「3月下旬」としました。
sen.e: Twelve themes for the contest were announced in late March: haze, nightingale, willow, cherry blossoms, kerria, wisteria, late spring, early summer, cuckoo (hototogisu), deutzia, summer grass, and love.
sen.cmt: If "鶯" can be either "bush warbler" or "nightingale," I think "nightingale" is a better choice for poetry; added "the contest"
sen.e: Twelve themes for the contest were announced in late March: haze, nightingale, willow, cherry blossoms, kerria, wisteria, late spring, early summer, cuckoo (hototogisu), deutzia, summer grass, and love.

sen.j: 鶯、郭公が各2、桜が3、恋が5の計20番で戦われた。
sen.e: The contest was fought with a total of 20 rounds, including two rounds each for the bush warbler theme and the cuckoo, three for the cherry blossom, and five for love.
The competition held contests for a total of twenty rounds, including two rounds each for the nightingale and cuckoo themes, three for cherry blossoms, and five for love.
sen.cmt: changed "fought" to "contests"; 20→twenty; bush warbler→nightingale; fixed grammar
sen.e: The competition held contests for a total of twenty rounds, including two rounds each for the nightingale and cuckoo themes, three for cherry blossoms, and five for love.

sen.j: 判者（はんじゃ勝敗を決める役）は左大臣藤原実頼,その補佐に大納言源高明（たかあきら）。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Saneyori, the Minister of the Left played the role of the judge (determining the winners and losers).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Saneyori, the Minister of the Left played the role of the judge (determining the winners and losers).
FUJIWARA no Saneyori, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), played the role of the judge (determining the winners and losers), assisted by MINAMOTO no Takaakira, Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 左大臣、大納言 を追加いました。

sen.j: 講師（こうじ歌を読み上げる役）は左方源延光、右方源博雅。
sen.e: Koji (reciters of poems) were MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu for the left side and MINAMOTO no Hiromasa for the right.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Koji (reciters of poems) were MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu for the left side and MINAMOTO no Hiromasa for the right.
Koji (reciters of poems) were MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu for the left side and MINAMOTO no Hiromasa for the right.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: 方人（かたうど；応援する役）には女房たちが左右に分かれ、それぞれ左方は赤（朱）、右方は青（緑）を基調に衣裳を揃えるなど趣向を凝らしたものであったという。
sen.e: Court ladies acting as supporters were divided into the left and the right, and each prepared elaborate costumes according to its base color which was red (emperor red) for the left and blue (green) for the right.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Court ladies acting as supporters were divided into the left and the right, and each prepared elaborate costumes according to its base color which was red (emperor red) for the left and blue (green) for the right.

Court ladies acting as supporters were divided to the left and right, each preparing elaborate costumes according to their base color, which was red (emperor red) for the left and blue (green) for the right.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: 当日は午後早くから会場となる清涼殿の準備が始まった。
sen.e: On the day of the poetry contest people began to prepare the Seiryoden Summer Palace which was the venue in the early afternoon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the day of the poetry contest people began to prepare the Seiryoden Summer Palace which was the venue in the early afternoon.
On the day of the contest, people began preparing the Seiryoden Summer Palace as the venue in the early afternoon.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました

sen.j: しかし左方の州浜の参上が遅れ、歌合が始まったときはすでに日が暮れていたといわれる。
sen.e: However the contest did not begin before the sunset because the suhama stand of the left side came late.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However the contest did not begin before the sunset because the suhama stand of the left side came late.
However, since the suhama stand for the left side came later, the contest did not begin before sunset.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 歌合は夜を徹して行われ、左方の10勝5敗5引き分けで終わった。
sen.e: It continued throughout the night, ending with the victory of the left with 10 wins, 5 losses and 5 draws.
It continued throughout the night, ending with the victory of the left with 10 wins, 5 losses and 5 draws.
It continued throughout the night, ending with the victory of the left with 10 wins, 5 losses and 5 draws.

sen.j: 歌合のあと管弦の遊びが催され、退出は翌朝のことであった。
sen.e: After it was over the participants enjoyed kangen (courtly gagaku music) until finally they left the palace next morning.
After it was over, the participants enjoyed kangen (courtly gagaku music) until finally leaving the palace the next morning.
After it was over, the participants enjoyed kangen (courtly gagaku music) until finally leaving the palace the next morning.

sen.j: 20番の内容
左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
倉橋の山のかひより春霞としをつみてやたちわらるらむ
sen.e: Spring haze will lay over the valley of Mt. Kurahashi, gathering layers of happy new years.
The spring haze will lay over the valley of Mt. Kurahashi, gathering layers of happy new years.
The spring haze will lay over the valley of Mt. Kurahashi, gathering layers of happy new years.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛
ふるさとは春めきにけりみよしのの御垣の原をかすみこめたり
sen.e: In my hometown spring is just around the corner as a haze hangs over the field in Mikaki.
In my hometown, spring is just around the corner as a haze hangs over the field in Mikaki.
In my hometown, spring is just around the corner as a haze hangs over the field in Mikaki.

sen.j: 2.ウグイス
sen.cmt: If ウグイス can be translated as either "bush warbler" or "nightingale," for a poem I would think "nightingale" would be used

sen.j: 左：源順（勝）
こほりだにとまらぬ春のたに風にまだうちとけぬうぐひすのこゑ
sen.e: Why don't bush warblers come out of their shells and hesitate to sing even though the spring wind is blowing to melt the ice?
Why don't nightingales come out of their shells and hesitate to sing even though the spring wind is blowing to melt the ice?
Why don't nightingales come out of their shells and hesitate to sing even though the spring wind is blowing to melt the ice?

sen.j: 右：平兼盛
わがやどにうぐひすいたくなくなるはにはもはだらに花やちるらむ
sen.e: Is it because my garden is unevenly covered by fallen plum blooms that bush warbles are persistently singing there?
Is it because my garden is unevenly covered by fallen plum blooms that nightingales are persistently singing there?
Is it because my garden is unevenly covered by fallen plum blooms that nightingales are persistently singing there?

sen.j: 左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
わがやどの梅がえになくうぐひすは風のたよりにかをやとめこし
sen.e: A bush warbler is singing on the branch of a plum tree in my garden; Searching for the scent, has it been guided by the wind?
A nightingale is singing on the branch of a plum tree in my garden; Searching for the scent, has it been guided by the wind?
A nightingale is singing on the branch of a plum tree in my garden; Searching for the scent, has it been guided by the wind?

sen.j: 右：平兼盛
しろたへの雪ふりやまぬ梅がえにいまぞうぐひすはるとなくなる
sen.e: I thought that it was still snowing on the branches of plum trees as in winter, but look there, bush warblers are singing spring songs.
I thought that it was still snowing on the branches of plum trees as in winter, but look there, nightingales are singing spring songs.
I thought that it was still snowing on the branches of plum trees as in winter, but look there, nightingales are singing spring songs.

sen.j: 4.ヤナギ
左：坂上望城
あらたまのとしをつむらむあをやぎのいとはいづれの春かたゆべき
sen.e: Weaving time over many years, green willows will always have plenty of threads to weave whenever spring comes.
Weaving time over many years, green willows will always have plenty of threads to weave whenever spring comes.
Weaving time over many years, green willows will always have plenty of threads to weave whenever spring comes.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（勝）
さほひめのいとそめかくるあをやぎをふきなみだりそ春の山風
sen.e: O spring breeze blowing across in the mountain!; please do not disturb the willows which look like green-dyed threads Princess Saho (the spring goddess) are hanging out to dry.
O spring breeze blowing across in the mountain!; please do not disturb the willows which look like green-dyed threads of the Princess Saho (the spring goddess) that are hanging out to dry.
sen.cmt: added "of the" before "Princess"; added "that" before "are hanging out to dry"
sen.e: O spring breeze blowing across in the mountain!; please do not disturb the willows which look like green-dyed threads of the Princess Saho (the spring goddess) that are hanging out to dry.

sen.j: 5.サクラ
sen.cmt: The singular, "Blossom" sounds unnatural here, so I changed it to plural

sen.j: 左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
あだなりとつねはしりにきさくらばなをしむほどだにのどけからなむ
sen.e: Why is it that my heart is troubled by the transience of cherry blossoms that I always knew full well?; I wish that I could stay calm for a while as I watch them falling.
Why is it that my heart is troubled by the transience of cherry blossoms that I always knew full well?; I wish that I could stay calm for a while as I watch them falling.
Why is it that my heart is troubled by the transience of cherry blossoms that I always knew full well?; I wish that I could stay calm for a while as I watch them falling.

sen.j: 右：清原元輔
よとともにちらずもあらなむさくら花あかぬ心はいつかたゆべき
sen.e: O cherry blossoms!; please do not go but stay as you are for a thousand years!; I shall never lose my interest in you who will not cease to fascinate me.
O cherry blossoms!; please do not go but stay as you are for a thousand years!; I shall never lose my interest in you who will not cease to fascinate me.
O cherry blossoms!; please do not go but stay as you are for a thousand years!; I shall never lose my interest in you who will not cease to fascinate me.

sen.cmt: The singular, "Blossom" sounds unnatural here, so I changed it to plural

sen.j: 左：大中臣能宣（持（じ；引き分けのこと））
さくらばな風にしちらぬものならばおもふことなき春にぞあらまし
sen.e: If the wind do not blow the cherry blossoms off the tree, there will be no spring to contemplate.
If the wind does not blow the cherry blossoms off the trees, there will be no spring to contemplate.
If the wind does not blow the cherry blossoms off the trees, there will be no spring to contemplate.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（持）
さくらばないろみゆるほどによをしへば歳のゆくをもしらでやみなむ
sen.e: Were I to pass through the world just in dreamily watching cherry blossoms, I would be ignorant of my aging process.
Were I to pass through the world only dreamily watching cherry blossoms, I would be ignorant of growing old.
sen.cmt: eliminated "process" as it didn't sound like it belonged in a poem
sen.e: Were I to pass through the world only dreamily watching cherry blossoms, I would be ignorant of growing old.

sen.cmt: The singular, "Blossom" sounds unnatural here, so I changed it to plural

sen.j: 左：少弐命婦（勝）
あしひきのやまがくれなるさくらばなちりのこれりと風にしらすな
sen.e: O cherry blossoms which still remain in the mountains!; please don't let the wind know that you are there.
O cherry blossoms which still remain in the mountains!; please don't let the wind know that you are there.
O cherry blossoms which still remain in the mountains!; please don't let the wind know that you are there.

sen.j: 右：中務
としごとにきつゝわがみるさくらばなかすみもいまはたちなかくしそ
sen.e: The cherry blossoms come and bloom for me to watch every year, so, O spring haze!, do not ever intend to cover them!
The cherry blossoms come and bloom for me to watch every year, so, O spring haze!, do not ever intend to cover them!
The cherry blossoms come and bloom for me to watch every year, so, O spring haze!, do not ever intend to cover them!

sen.j: 8.款冬（ヤマブキ）
sen.cmt: added description since I had to look up "Kerria" and ヤマブキ

sen.j: 左：源順（勝）
春がすみ井手のかはなみたちかへりみてこそゆかめやまぶきの花
sen.e: Let us go back to the riverside in Ide to appreciate the kerria there.
Let us go back to the riverside in Ide to appreciate the kerria there.
Let us go back to the riverside in Ide to appreciate the kerria there.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛
ひとへづゝやへ山ぶきはひらけなむほどへてにほふはなとたのまむ
sen.e: I wish the Japanese rose would blossom petal by petal, so I could enjoy its beauty much longer.
I wish the kerria would blossom petal by petal, so I could enjoy their beauty much longer.
I wish the kerria would blossom petal by petal, so I could enjoy their beauty much longer.

sen.j: 9.フジ (植物)
左：藤原朝忠卿
むらさきににほふふぢなみうちはえてまつにぞちよのいろはかゝれる
sen.e: The violet of wisteria is shining brilliantly against the backdrop of the pine trees in celebration of longevity.
The violet of wisteria is shining brilliantly against the backdrop of the pine trees in celebration of longevity.
The violet of wisteria is shining brilliantly against the backdrop of the pine trees in celebration of longevity.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（勝）
われゆきていろみるばかり住吉のきしのふぢなみをりなつくしそ
sen.e: Please do not cut the wisteria flowers in the Sumiyoshi riverside until I come and look at its beautiful color.
Please do not cut the wisteria flowers on the Sumiyoshi riverside until I come to look at their beautiful colors.
Please do not cut the wisteria flowers on the Sumiyoshi riverside until I come to look at their beautiful colors.

sen.j: 10.暮春
左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
はなだにもちらでわかるゝ春ならばいとかく今日はをしまましやは
sen.e: Would I not be so sad as I am today, if I part with spring without the scattering of flowers?
Would I not be so sad as I am today if I had parted with spring without the scattering of flowers?
Would I not be so sad as I am today if I had parted with spring without the scattering of flowers?

sen.j: 右：藤原博古
ゆくはるのとまりをしふるものならばわれもふなでておくれざらまし
sen.e: If I knew where spring departs, I also would not be late in leaving the port.
If I knew where spring departs, I also would not be late in leaving the port.
If I knew where spring departs, I also would not be late in leaving the port.

sen.j: 11.首夏
左：大中臣能宣（持）
なくこゑはまだきかねどもせみのはのうすきころもをたちぞきてける
sen.e: I changed into my new summer kimono which I had made of the thin silk cloth like the wings of a cicada, even though I did not hear cicadas buzz.
I changed into my new summer kimono which I had made of the thin silk cloth like the wings of a cicada, even though I did not hear the buzz of the cicada.
sen.cmt: cicadas buzz→the buzz of the cicada
sen.e: I changed into my new summer kimono which I had made of the thin silk cloth like the wings of a cicada, even though I did not hear the buzz of the cicada.

sen.j: 右：中務（持）
夏ごろもたちいづるけふは花ざくらかたみのいろもぬぎやかふらむ
sen.e: Today when I shall begin to cut the summer cloth, the cherry blossoms will be all gone to change into summer green.
Today when I shall begin to cut the summer cloth, the cherry blossoms will be all gone to change into summer green.
Today when I shall begin to cut the summer cloth, the cherry blossoms will be all gone to change into summer green.

sen.j: 12.卯花
左：壬生忠見
みちとほみ人もかよはぬ奥山にさけるうのはなたれとをらまし
sen.e: With whom can I cut the deutzia blossoming in the deep mountain so remote that nobody visits?
With whom can I cut the deutzia blossoming in the deep mountain, so remote that nobody visits?
With whom can I cut the deutzia blossoming in the deep mountain, so remote that nobody visits?

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（勝）
あらしのみさむきみやまのうのはなはきえせぬ雪とあやまたれつゝ
sen.e: Deutzia blooming in the mountain where only storms arise could almost be mistaken for snow that never goes.
Deutzia blooming in the mountain where only storms arise could almost be mistaken for snow that never disappears.
Deutzia blooming in the mountain where only storms arise could almost be mistaken for snow that never disappears.

sen.j: 13.ホトトギス（ほとゝぎす）
左：坂上望城（持）
ほのかにぞなきわたるなるほとゝぎすみやまをいづるけさのはつこゑ
sen.e: Listen to the dainty songs of cuckoos!; they have come out of the deep mountain to make their first singing lesson.
Listen to the dainty songs of cuckoos!; they have come out of the deep mountain to give their first singing lesson.
Listen to the dainty songs of cuckoos!; they have come out of the deep mountain to give their first singing lesson.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（持）
みやまいでてよはにやいつるほとゝぎすあかつきかけてこゑのきこゆる
sen.e: Cuckoos were wandering out into the countryside at night; I heard them sing at dawn.
Cuckoos were wandering out into the countryside at night; I heard them sing at dawn.
Cuckoos were wandering out into the countryside at night; I heard them sing at dawn.

sen.j: 14.郭公
左：壬生忠見（持）
さよふけてねざめざりせばほとゝぎす人づてにこそきくべかりけれ
sen.e: Had I not woke up in the middle of the night, I would have had to be told by others about the cuckoo's first voice.
Had I not woke up in the middle of the night, I would have needed to be told by others about the cuckoo's first voice.
Had I not woke up in the middle of the night, I would have needed to be told by others about the cuckoo's first voice.

sen.j: 右：藤原元真（持）
人ならばまててふべきをほとゝとぎすふたこゑとだにきかですぎぬる
sen.e: A cuckoo has flown away before I can hear it sing twice; I would say, "wait" if it were a man.
A cuckoo has flown away before I can hear it sing twice; I would say, "wait" if it were a man.
A cuckoo has flown away before I can hear it sing twice; I would say, "wait" if it were a man.

sen.j: 15夏草
左：壬生忠見（勝）
夏ぐさのなかをつゆけみかきわけてかる人なしにしげる野辺かな
sen.e: Summer grasses have so fully grown in the field that nobody would dare to go in to cut them down.
Summer grasses have so fully grown in the field that nobody would dare go in to cut them down.
Summer grasses have so fully grown in the field that nobody would dare go in to cut them down.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛
なつふかくなりぞしにけるおはらぎのもりのしたくさなべて人かる
sen.e: Summer is in full swing as people are cutting down the underbrush in the woods of Oaraki.
Summer is in full swing as people are cutting down the underbrush in the woods of Oaraki.
Summer is in full swing as people are cutting down the underbrush in the woods of Oaraki.

sen.j: 左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
ひとづてにしらせてしがなかくれぬのみこもりにのみこひやわたらむ
sen.e: How I wish that somebody told her that I am in love with her; otherwise I could no longer keep it secret.
How I wish that somebody told her that I am in love with her; otherwise I could no longer keep it secret.
How I wish that somebody told her that I am in love with her; otherwise I could no longer keep it secret.

sen.j: 右：中務
むばたまのよるのゆめだにまさしくばわがおもふことをひとにみせばや
sen.e: If the dreams I dream every night were true, I could reveal my secret love to the one I love.
If the dreams I dream every night were true, I could reveal my secret love to the one I love.
If the dreams I dream every night were true, I could reveal my secret love to the one I love.

sen.j: 左：大中臣能宣（勝）
こひしきをなににつけてかなぐさめむゆめにもみえずぬるよなければ
sen.e: What can sooth my burning love, which deprives me of sleeping at night so dreaming her in my dream?
What can sooth my burning love which deprives me from sleeping at night, so dreaming of her in my sleep?
sen.cmt: of→from; moved comma; dreaming her→dreaming of her; dream→sleep
sen.e: What can sooth my burning love which deprives me from sleeping at night, so dreaming of her in my sleep?

sen.j: 右：中務
きみこふるこゝろはそらにあまのはらかひなくてふる月日なりけり
sen.e: My heart would fly to the sky to let the rain of love fall upon you; yet in reality it is only time that passes in vain.
My heart would fly to the sky to let the rain of love fall upon you; yet in reality it is only time that passes in vain.
My heart would fly to the sky to let the rain of love fall upon you; yet in reality it is only time that passes in vain.

sen.j: 左：本院侍従（持）
ひとしれずあふをまつまにこひしなばなににかへたるいのちとかいはむ
sen.e: What would I sacrifice my life for, if I died in just waiting to see her without revealing to her that I love her?
What would I have sacrificed my life for, if I died just waiting to see her without revealing to her my love?
What would I have sacrificed my life for, if I died just waiting to see her without revealing to her my love?

sen.j: 右：中務（持）
ことならばくもゐの月となりななむこひしきかげやそらにみゆると
sen.e: If I cannot see you, I will make you into the moon so that I can fondly look at you.
If I cannot see you, I will turn you into the moon so that I can look at you fondly.
If I cannot see you, I will turn you into the moon so that I can look at you fondly.

sen.j: 左：藤原朝忠卿（勝）
あふことのたえてしなくばなかなかに人をもみをもうらみざらまし
sen.e: Had I not seen you, I could not have suffered from this pain of not being able to see you.
Had I not seen you, I would not suffer from this pain of not being able to see you.
Had I not seen you, I would not suffer from this pain of not being able to see you.

sen.j: 右：藤原元真
きみこふとかつはきえつつふるものをかくてもいけるみとやみるらむ
sen.e: I am as good as dead loving you too much; still, will you say that I do not love you enough because I am alive?
I am as good as dead loving you so much; still, will you say that I do not love you enough because I am alive?
I am as good as dead loving you so much; still, will you say that I do not love you enough because I am alive?

sen.j: 左：壬生忠見
こひすてふわがなはまだきたちにけりひとしれずこそおもひそめしか
sen.e: Everybody calls me the lover although I have just fallen in love with someone in secret.
Everybody calls me the lover, although I have just fallen in love with someone in secret.
Everybody calls me the lover, although I have just fallen in love with someone in secret.

sen.j: 右：平兼盛（勝）
しのぶれどいろに出でにけりわがこひはものやおもふとひとのとふまで
sen.e: However hard I may try to hide, my face cannot help but show that I am in love, so people keep asking me it.
However hard I may try to hide it, my face cannot help but show that I am in love, so people continue to ask me about it.
sen.cmt: added "it" after "hide"; keep asking me it→continue to ask me about it
sen.e: However hard I may try to hide it, my face cannot help but show that I am in love, so people continue to ask me about it.

sen.j: 逸話
博雅の読み違え
sen.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字にしました。

sen.j: 三番の鶯の歌のとき、右方の講師である源博雅は誤って四番の柳の歌を読み上げてしまった。
sen.e: In the third round on the bush warbler MINAMOTO no Hiromasa who was the reciter of the right side mistakenly red out the willow poem which was meant for the fourth round.
In the third round of the nightingale theme, MINAMOTO no Hiromasa, who was the reciter of the right side, mistakenly read the willow poem meant for the fourth round.
In the third round of the nightingale theme, MINAMOTO no Hiromasa, who was the reciter of the right side, mistakenly read the willow poem meant for the fourth round.

sen.j: 左方の方人から指摘があり、改めて鶯の歌を読み上げることとなった。
sen.e: Corrected by the supporters of the left, he was to read aloud the bush warbler poem anew.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Corrected by the supporters of the left, he was to read aloud the bush warbler poem anew.
Corrected by the supporters of the left, he was to read aloud the nightingale poem anew.

sen.j: だが恥じ入る余り顔面蒼白となり、声も震えてうまく読むことが出来なかったという。
sen.e: Yet he was so ashamed that his face lost color.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yet he was so ashamed that his face lost color.
He was so ashamed, however, that his face lost its color and with a trembling voice he was unable to recite properly.

sen.j: 忠見の悶死
sen.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字にしました。

sen.j: 二十番の勝負において判者の実頼は優劣を付けられず、持にしようとした。
sen.e: In the 20th round the judge could not decide the winner and suggested the draw.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the 20th round the judge could not decide the winner and suggested the draw.
In the 20th round, Saneyori, the judge, could not decide on a winner and suggested a draw.

sen.j: だが帝から勝敗を付けるようにとの仰せがあった。
sen.e: The emperor however insisted that he should settle on the winner and loser.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The emperor however insisted that he should settle on the winner and loser.
The Emperor, however, insisted that he should settle on a winner and loser.

sen.j: 実頼は補佐の高明に決めてもらおうとしたが高明は平伏して何も言わない。
sen.e: Saneyori asked his assistant, Takaakira, to decide, but the latter remained silent with his face on the ground.
Saneyori asked his assistant, Takaakira, to decide, but the latter remained silent with his face toward the ground.
sen.cmt: "face on the ground" does not accurately describe "平伏" in this situation, so I changed it to "face toward the ground"
sen.e: Saneyori asked his assistant, Takaakira, to decide, but the latter remained silent with his face toward the ground.

sen.j: 実頼は窮したが、その時帝が「しのぶれど」と兼盛の歌を口ずさんでいるのを高明が聞きつけ、実頼に伝えた。
sen.e: Saneyori was at a loss what to do. Thereupon Takaakira heard the emperor mumbling, 'shinoburedo' which was a part of Kanemori's line. He told this to Saneyori.
Saneyori was at a loss at what to do, but as Takaakira heard the emperor mumbling, "shinoburedo" which was a part of Kanemori's line, Takaakira conveyed this to Saneyori.
Saneyori was at a loss at what to do, but as Takaakira heard the emperor mumbling, 'shinoburedo' which was a part of Kanemori's line, Takaakira conveyed this to Saneyori.

sen.j: それでようやく実頼も決心が付き、右方の勝ちと判定を下した。
sen.e: Saneyori finally made up his mind and judged that the right won.
Saneyori finally made up his mind and judged the right side as the winner.
sen.cmt: Though it should be clear by now what "right" is referring to, the way it is used in trans 1 is possibly ambiguous, so I fixed it to read more naturally
sen.e: Saneyori finally made up his mind and judged the right side as the winner.

sen.j: その間、左右の講師はずっと歌を読み上げ続けていた。
sen.e: During this time the reciters of both sides kept reciting the poems.
During this time the reciters of both sides kept reciting the poems.
During this time the reciters of both sides kept reciting the poems.

sen.j: 卑官だった壬生忠見は、出世を懸けて詠んだ歌が接戦の末に負けたことを悲観した。
sen.e: MIBUNO no Tadami who was a low-rank officer was utterly disappointed that his poem, which he had read in hope of advancement in life, was defeated in such a tight match.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: MIBUNO no Tadami who was a low-rank officer was utterly disappointed that his poem, which he had read in hope of advancement in life, was defeated in such a tight match.
MIBU no Tadami, who was a low-rank officer, was utterly disappointed that his poem that he had composed in hope of advancement in life was beaten in such a tight match.
sen.cmt: , which he had read→that he had composed

sen.j: その後食べ物を受け付けなくなり、そのまま死んだといわれている。
sen.e: After the contest he developed anorexia and eventually died.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the contest he developed anorexia and eventually died.
After the contest he developed anorexia and eventually died.
